p: The EO of L. pubescens has been reported to exhibit a strong wide-ranging in vitro antibacterial activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria including Salmonella enterica, Staphylococcus aureus, Micrococcus luteus, Enterococcus faecalis, and Escherichia coli [ 6, 13, 15] and hepatoprotective [ 16], cytotoxic, and xanthine-oxidase inhibitory activities [ 6, 8].
